page.title: 04LOCAL HISTORY NOTES.
page.content:
amount of restoration,and several of their monuments are to be found in the chancel.During the 1870s,the prosperity resulting from the coprolite digging contributed to the last major restoration of the whole building.Notable among those who have ministered here is Bishop Mackenzie, who was curate-in-charge 1851-1855, and led the first mission to Central Africa,where he died of fever.There is a memorial window to him in the church.
(Reproduced by kind permission of Haslingfield Parish Council).
